Data: Broad to Clarke, 1 run tucked off the pads out to deep square-leg
Broad to Marsh, no run full outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
Broad to Marsh, 2 runs a nice piece of timing through the leg side as he flicks a straight delivery in front of square...nearly reaches the short boundary
Broad to Marsh, 1 run touch fuller on middle and off, Marsh closes the face and finds a gap at square leg
Broad to Clarke, no run full outside off, a slightly flat-footed drive by Clarke but safe enough
Broad to Clarke, no run short ball outside off stump, Clarke doesn't have to do much more than just nod his head out of the way
Bresnan to Marsh, no run defended to backward point
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run fuller delivery, driven towards mid-off and it's the lack of timing that gives him time for a comfortable single
Bresnan to Clarke, no run defended with soft hands square into the off side but Morgan is quickly in from point
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs neatly worked off the stumps and bisects long leg and deep square
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run too straight and tucked off his hip down to long leg
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run back of a length, taken from off stump into midwicket...good rotation of the strike, but only three boundaries so far
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run round the wicket, driven out to deep cover
Tredwell to Clarke, 1 run stays round the wicket, Clarke uses his feet then tucks him off the stumps through square leg
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run down the pitch and pushes up to long-on
Tredwell to Clarke, no run pushed into the on side and Tredwell gets across
Tredwell to Clarke, no run more footwork down the pitch but picks out square leg this time
Tredwell to Clarke, no run touch shorter, Clarke rocks back and drives to cover
Bresnan to Marsh, no run full on middle and off, defended and Bresnan skips across from his followthrough to field
Bresnan to Marsh, no run tries to work a straight delivery into midwicket but doesn't get it much further than the cut strip
Bresnan to Marsh, no run more power in this shot, a bottom-handed whip to a full delivery but it goes straight to midwicket
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run outside off, runs it down to third man
Bresnan to Clarke, no run adjusts well to the right hander, on off stump, defended down into the pitch and it bounces back towards the keeper

Bresnan to Clarke, OUT all over for Clarke! The pressure brings another breakthrough. Clarke tried to heave a length ball through the leg side, it was a pretty ugly shot and takes a bottom edge into off stump which ends up out of the ground
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run full from round the wicket, driven down the ground
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run uses his feet and gets off the mark to long-on
Tredwell to Marsh, no run full at off stump, opens the face and finds point
Tredwell to Marsh, FOUR runs that's an excellent shot, whips it from off stump wide of mid-on for a rare boundary
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run mid-on has gone deep so this time it's an easy single down the ground
Tredwell to Bailey, no run flicked off the stumps to square leg
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run full and straying a touch on the pads as he whips it through to deep square leg
Bresnan to Bailey, no run nudges forward as he meets this fullish ball on off stump with a push into the covers.
Bresnan to Bailey, no run safely behind that length ball, but he was looking to clip it through the midwicket region for a single, but none is available
Bresnan to Bailey, no run nicely behind this again as Bresnan plugs away just outside off
Bresnan to Bailey, no run good length ball, just outside off as Bailey prods forward and defends
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 leg bye this time the fuller ball slides down leg and I think it went off the pads as he looked to glance it down.
Tredwell to Bailey, no run closed the face too early there, but the leading edge doesn't carry to the bowler
Tredwell to Bailey, no run again, looking to nudge it through midwicket and he ends up edging it towards the vacant silly point region
Tredwell to Bailey, no run more circumspect this time as he defends the fullish offspinner off the front foot
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run moves well across his off stump and ramps it behind to fine leg for a single. Almost premeditated that to fight the line Tredwell is bowling
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run chips down the track and finds long-off for complete an easy single
Tredwell to Bailey, no run seen him advance again as he shortened the length. Bailey has to settle for no runs as he finds midwicket with a clip
Bresnan to Marsh, no run really tight bowling from Bresnan, keeps it just short of a good length on and around off stump as Marsh blocks to the covers
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run goes back and plays with soft hands as he dabs it into the off side and before cover can come swooping in on the ball, the batsman run through for the single
Bresnan to Bailey, no run prods forward to meet the good length ball with a defensive bat.
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run a thickish outside edge carries the length ball on off stump to deep third man. Bailey did open the face there as he played from the crease
Bresnan to Marsh, 1 run and there's a bit of variation. 118 kph-slower ball as Marsh tucks off of the front foot into midwicket and collects a single
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run followed by the short ball, not rising enough to trouble Bailey though as he pulls it down and has timed it well enough. There is protection at deep midwicket though.
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs oh, Buttler saw and and was rushing down leg to try and block the lap-sweep from Bailey. But he gets good enough bat to get the ball above the keeper
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run flighted on off stump as he reaches the pitch and drives into the covers
Tredwell to Marsh, 1 run has a little nip down the track and having reached to the pitch, turns it just wide of mid-on. A little fumble allows the batsmen to sneak a single
Tredwell to Bailey, no run Bailey advances now but with the length being shortened again, he can only nudge it to the leg side
Tredwell to Bailey, 2 runs again Buttler anticipates the sweep from Bailey and tries to keep it to none, but the ball is lobbed over the keeper's outstretched arms
Tredwell to Bailey, no run rocks back and makes room outside leg to cut the ball through point
Stokes to Marsh, no run just back of a length outside off as Marsh gets in line and blocks
Stokes to Marsh, no run fuller on off stump as he draws Marsh forward and limits him to a defensive push down the pitch
Stokes to Marsh, no run length ball on off as this time Marsh chooses to play off the back foot. Opens the face and guides it to point

Stokes to Marsh, OUT and he's done it! Marsh has clipped it straight to short midwicket! He's been setting a foundation, but that should might not have been part of the plan. Innocuous length ball on the pads and it was there to be whipped away through the leg side. Perhaps it might have come a little slower o
Stokes to Maxwell, no run solidly behind the first one, which was just short of a good length on middle and off
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run and he's off and running, exploiting a length ball on the pads and clipping it away to deep square leg.
Jordan to Maxwell, no run this one had very little though. 110 kph slower ball as he gets right forward and blocks
Jordan to Maxwell, 2 runs full and sliding down leg as Maxwell leans forward and glances it down to long leg rather nicely.
Jordan to Maxwell, no run short cover does well there, cutting across to his right and diving to keep that elegant drive, hit on the up from Maxwell. Jordan's keeping it nice and full

Jordan to Maxwell, no run darts in off the pitch and Jordan likes it. But I suspect it might have missed leg. Hit on the knee-roll too as Maxwell is caught on the crease. Was hurrying to flick it away but he wasn't quick enough to combat the movement
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 run fullish on off and it moves into him again, but this time Maxwell manages to squirt it away through square leg
Jordan to Bailey, 1 run length ball, hitting the bat rather heavily as Bailey pulls off the bottom hand and places the ball into the midwicket region
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run loses his radar this time as he offers up a full toss outside off. Bailey fails to capitalise as he goes forward and smacks it straight to point
Stokes to Maxwell, no run very full outside off again, just inside the wide line as Maxwell looks to chop it to third man, but doesn't connect

Stokes to Maxwell, no run full on the stumps as he drives quite nicely. Stokes gets a finger on it and the ball deflects onto the stumps as there is a bit of an appeal, but Bailey had plonked his bat inside
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run full and angling in on the pads as he clips it away through square leg
Stokes to Bailey, no run full and just outside off as he drives down the ground
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs aha, we have a boundary. The first since seven overs as Bailey clips a full delivery angled in at him straight of deep midwicket
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 leg bye shortish and on the hips as he works it away towards fine leg
Jordan to Bailey, no run fullish and targeting the stumps but Bailey is equal to the challenge

Jordan to Bailey, 1 run no movement of the feet there as Jordan generates some inward movement off a good length. Thick inside edge helps him get off strike as the ball wanders away through square leg
Jordan to Maxwell, no run length ball on the stumps as he looks to whip it away, but can't get bat to ball
Jordan to Maxwell, no run pounds in on a good length as Maxwell comes forward to defend
Jordan to Maxwell, 1 run opens the face and chops this back of a length ball outside off just to the right of the keeper
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run that gap just in front of square leg is proving quite useful as this short of a good length delivery is tucked away for another single

Stokes to Bailey, 1 leg bye very tight single but Bailey makes it, courtesy the throw being deflected off his bat as he was grounding it. He'd missed the flick and Maxwell calls him through. Stokes gets to the ball quickly but can't strike the stumps direct
Stokes to Maxwell, no run fullish on middle and off as he defends off the front foot
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run strays down the pads as he looks to whip it away, but has to settle for a leg bye to long leg
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run width offered outside off stump, but it was nice and full again as Bailey sinks low and meets it with an open face
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run goes short this time and the line was right on middle too, but Maxwell covers it well as he goes ball and pulls it down to fine leg for a single
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run length outside off as he punches it off the front foot to deep point with little fuss
Bopara to Bailey, FOUR runs very clever. It had enough width for Bailey to nudge forward and open the face. Got it fine enough to beat deep third man for another boundary.
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run this time he can't get it as fine and backward point keeps it to a single
Bopara to Maxwell, no run went a touch wide of the crease that time as he keeps it full and on off stump. Maxwell drives back to the bowler
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run pushed to long-on as he meets the length ball with a good straight bat
Bopara to Bailey, no run ducks in a touch off the pitch, which makes Bailey pull out a short-armed jab to midwicket
Stokes to Maxwell, no run looks to dab the back of a length ball behind point, but can't place it well enough
Stokes to Maxwell, no run draws him forward and Maxwell meets the full length ball outside off with a straight bat. Can't get it far enough away from the bowler though
Stokes to Maxwell, no run tries a late cut, but there wasn't enough width there. Good delivery from Stokes, just short of a good length and around fifth stump
Stokes to Maxwell, 2 runs full and just wide enough outside off for him to lean forward and play a solid cover drive
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 leg bye stifled appeal as this is full and pushed into the pads of Maxwell. Was always going down leg
Stokes to Bailey, no run fullish on off stump as he comes forward to block
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run worked away towards the square leg region as he rides the angle of this full length ball coming in at him
Bopara to Bailey, no run length ball on the stumps, Bailey is content to keep it out.
Bopara to Bailey, no run shortish, but it didn't rise high enough which foiled that pull stroke. The ball lobs off the thigh and down to the keeper
Bopara to Bailey, no run turns the full length ball on the pads to square leg
Bopara to Bailey, no run full and just outside off as he drives, but can't time it well enough
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run nudged away to deep midwicket off the front foot as this was full and sneaking down leg
Stokes to Bailey, no run length on off stump as he keeps to his crease and defends
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run opens the face to run the fullish ball outside off down to third man
Stokes to Maxwell, no run head right over this one kept on a good length on off stump as he defends off the front foot
Stokes to Maxwell, 1 run third man has more work as Maxwell guides the back of a length ball away from off stump
Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs punished and how! That brings up the hundred for Australia as Bailey pounces onto the width on offer. Rocks back and cuts it behind point with considerable authority
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs compensates as he tightens his line and in the process strays into the pads as he tucks it to long leg for a couple
Bopara to Maxwell, FOUR runs the run-rate's definitely on an upswing now. strays on the pads with a full length ball and Maxwell flicks it to the leg of short fine leg and has timed it quite well
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run on the stumps again as this is punched to long-on for a single
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run fullish on middle as he pushes down to long-on off the front foot
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run fullish and just outside off as Maxwell presses forward and steers it just behind point for a single.
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run touch fuller and he ensures the line is well outside off as Bailey guides it away to deep point
Bopara to Maxwell, 1 run full and seeking off stump but Maxwell moves confidently onto his front foot and drives to deep cover
Stokes to Maxwell, no run searches for the blockhole and he finds it. Maxwell can do little more than stop the ball from crashing into the stumps

Stokes to Maxwell, OUT Stokes does it again! Maxwell nicks off! He was doing reasonably well, especially with those drives through cover and dabs to third man, but this time he can't get good enough bat. It was fullish and he wanted to run it to third man again, but only manages a healthy edge through to the k
Stokes to Wade, no run full and just outside off as he drives towards mid-off
Stokes to Wade, 1 run off the mark with a flick down to deep midwicket as this was on a length and on leg stump
Stokes to Bailey, no run fullish and on the stumps as he is able to keep it out with a push to mid-on
Stokes to Bailey, no run ventures fuller and just outside off as he drives off the back foot. Mid-on is in play again and keeps it to none
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run bit shortish and outside off as he goes back and punches through to deep cover
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run charges him and reaches to the pitch, but still plays with the turn. Clipped to deep midwicket and he runs with the shot for a single
Tredwell to Wade, no run pushed through on middle and leg as Wade can only defend off the back foot
Tredwell to Wade, no run another venture down the track but the new batsman can't find his timing or placement. Tredwell is safely behind it
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run tossed up and angled into the pads as he turns it behind square leg for a single
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run silly misfield means the over ends with a single to long-on. He reached forward and dabbed it straight of midwicket, and the fielder dived over the ball
Stokes to Bailey, no run fullish and on off stump as he pushes to mid-off. Nice stride forward from Bailey
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run easily clipped off the pads as this was on a length and targeting leg stump. Deep square leg keeps it to one
Stokes to Wade, no run strides forward and drives through the line of the full length ball outside off, but cannot get it past mid-off
Stokes to Wade, 1 run fullish on middle, and he plonks the front foot towards the off side and nudges it towards the midwicket region and picks up a single
Stokes to Bailey, 2 runs Bailey hustles and he gets through for a couple after flicking this length ball off the pads to fine leg

Stokes to Bailey, FOUR runs dangerous, but effective. Full toss outside off and Bailey might have ended up looking rather silly had mid-on managed to get his hands to that. But the chip had enough power on it to beat his dive and run away for four
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run moves deep in his crease and punches the length ball into the covers
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run chips down the track and places the tossed up ball on leg stump square of fine leg to pick up a single.
Tredwell to Wade, no run tossed up and it goes on with the arm with very little spin. Wade ventures down the track and gets an inside edge onto pad
Tredwell to Wade, no run another little dance down the wicket but he can hit the flighted ball on middle only as far as the bowler
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run steers this full ball through the covers for a single
Tredwell to Bailey, no run touch short just outside off as he goes back to cut, but gets a thick inside edge
Bresnan to Wade, no run length on and around off stump as he blocks from the crease with an open face
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run walks at him and moves outside off stump and dabs it into the midwicket region
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run more work for midwicket as Bailey works the length ball
Bresnan to Wade, 2 runs takes advantage of Bresnan straying in line. Picks the ball off his hips and flicks it fine to long leg.
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run goes for the hook, but has not got hold of it at all. Good short ball from Bresnan, possibly catching Wade off guard. But it lands safely despite deep square leg running in

Bresnan to Bailey, 3 runs touch short and the bit of width allows Bailey to cut the ball and time it well enough to make deep third man's job quite difficult. But he slides and pulls the ball back to keep it to three
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run uses the feet and drives down to long-on
Tredwell to Wade, no run Wade leans out to defend to the off side
Tredwell to Wade, no run drives harder to cover but can't find the gap
Tredwell to Wade, 1 run nudged away edgily behind point for a quick single
Tredwell to Bailey, no run Tredwell is around the wicket to Bailey, who pushes the ball to off
Tredwell to Bailey, 1 run gets one on the legs and whips it away to deep square leg
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run clipped away through midwicket for a single
Bresnan to Wade, no run Wade works this from on off stump to midwicket but can't find the gap
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run walks across the stumps and tries to create something but all he manages is a little inside edge onto the body for a quick single to off
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run Bailey brings up his half-century with a late cut down to third man
Bresnan to Wade, no run nudged away to the off side
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run a touch shorter now and Wade pulls through the leg side for a single
Broad to Wade, 1 run worked away off the pads for a run down to fine leg
Broad to Bailey, no run good line just outside off and Bailey can't beat point
Broad to Bailey, 1 run on the pads and Bailey clips another one through leg
Broad to Wade, no run Wade again nudges into the leg side and can't find a run
Broad to Wade, 2 runs walks across and down the pitch and whips it away to fine leg and this is sharp running as Wade hurries back for two
Broad to Wade, 1 leg bye on the pads but Wade doesn't get bat on ball, settles for a leg bye instead
Bresnan to Wade, no run on the back foot now, Wade crunches it back towards Bresnan
Bresnan to Wade, no run Wade goes the big pull here as he gets something a touch short but he can't get bat on ball - much like in Perth, he's looking pretty scratchy
Bresnan to Wade, no run nudged away to the off side
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run tries to create something again by walking across his stumps but Bresnan follows him, and Wade can only open the face and run this down to third man
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run Bailey waits on a late cut and picks up one to third man

Bresnan to Wade, FOUR runs this time Wade gets his pull away, and he's placed it well enough that it bounces over the boundary for four. There was a man at deep midwicket but this went squarer and Wade will be relieved to have his first boundary on the board
Broad to Bailey, no run full face of the bat from Bailey as he pushes to off
Broad to Bailey, 1 wide down leg side now and the Australians pick up a bonus run
Broad to Bailey, 1 run Broad angles this in to the pads and with a man at deep midwicket Bailey's flick is just for a single
Broad to Wade, 1 run again Wade goes for it when he gets a bouncer but doesn't middle this, has to settle for a single to deep fine leg
Broad to Bailey, no run defended solidly back down the pitch
Broad to Bailey, no run on the back foot now, Bailey defends
Broad to Bailey, 1 run good line just outside off draws a thick edge as Bailey drives hard at this, it turns into a single to third man
Jordan to Bailey, no run angled in to Bailey's off stump, he defends to leg
Jordan to Bailey, 1 run push and run now as Bailey takes off for a quick single to mid-on
Jordan to Wade, no run Wade nudges out towards cover point and can't find a run

Jordan to Wade, 1 leg bye lbw shout here from Jordan and this didn't look too bad, maybe just pitching a touch outside leg? The umpire wasn't really interested. He was struck in line but possibly height an issue too. Pretty close shout, but England don't have a review left
Jordan to Bailey, no run down leg and clips the pad on the way through
Jordan to Bailey, no run Bailey gets a little width but his drive can't beat cover

Stokes to Wade, FOUR runs Stokes gives Wade something short and wide to start with and Wade pounces on it - he has thrown everything at a cut and to the short square boundaries at this ground that was always going to be four
Stokes to Wade, 1 run now Wade mistimes a little but gets a single to cover
Stokes to Bailey, 1 run Bailey waits and plays this very late, steers a single down to third man
Stokes to Wade, 1 run Wade walks down the pitch and works one out to deep midwicket along the ground

Stokes to Bailey, OUT Bailey tries to lift the scoring rate here and he's perished doing it, he's planted the front foot and tried to crunch Stokes straight down the ground but drags it towards mid-on instead, and Stuart Broad takes a good catch.
Stokes to Faulkner, no run Faulkner defends his first ball back towards the bowler
Jordan to Wade, no run Jordan attacks the middle and leg line, Wade works to mid-on
Jordan to Wade, 2 runs Wade clips this off his hips and some very sharp running again turns it into two
Jordan to Wade, no run again Wade gets one on the pads and can't find the gap at midwicket
Jordan to Wade, no run walks across the stumps and tries to steer this behind midwicket but just finds the fielder again
Jordan to Wade, 1 run shorter now and Wade pulls a single out to deep midwicket
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 run Faulkner leans out to defend and gets off the mark with a thick inside edge away behind square

Broad to Faulkner, FOUR runs horrible ball to start from Broad, just a rank delivery way down leg and Faulker manages to get bat on ball, which was all he had to do to tickle this away for a boundary to fine leg
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run pushed out through point for another single
Broad to Wade, no run Wade defensively pushes away to off
Broad to Wade, no run tries to cut hard now but this ball was perhaps just a touch too straight to cut, it beats the bat through to Buttler

Broad to Wade, OUT oh, Wade has been bowled behind his legs! Wade has been walking across his stumps quite often in this innings, this time he doesn't get bat on Ball and Broad pitches it just outside leg and it goes on with the angle to take the leg stump
Broad to Coulter-Nile, no run pushed away to mid-off
Stokes to Faulkner, no run fullish from Stokes and Faulkner drives to mid-off
Stokes to Faulkner, no run steered away towards point off the face of the gap
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run Stokes tries for the yorker but Faulkner is good enough to glance this fine
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 wide wide down leg side now gives Australia a bonus run
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, no run fullish and straightish, Coulter-Nile pushes it away to cover
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 run again Stokes goes full, and Coulter-Nile gets off the mark with a run down to third man
Stokes to Faulkner, no run Faulkner leans outside off to defend
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run angled down onto the pads and Coulter-Nile tries to go aerial again but just tickles it off the pad to fine leg

Bresnan to Faulkner, FOUR runs Faulkner gets on away to the boundary now, he's really opened up and gone for a slog through cow corner - it has only just managed to beat the man at wide midwicket in the circle
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run fuller and wide of off, Faulkner can only nudge a single

Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs Coulter-Nile has decided he too will go after Bresnan, and he's planted the foot and launched a drive over wide mid-off, well struck and this bounces away to the boundary
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run more width and this time he crunches it through point
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run Faulkner drives hard to mid-off and takes a single to keep the strike
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 run Faulkner backs away and Jordan follows him, this ball is clipped away through square leg to bring up the 200 for Australia
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye Coulter-Nile tries to hoick this over leg but another one just dribbles off the leg for a leg bye
Jordan to Faulkner, 1 run good yorker length ball that Faulkner clips away through midwicket and they want two but the fielding is sharp enough to prevent it
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run again a good yorker from Jordan, all Coulter-Nile can do is clip it away through square leg
Jordan to Faulkner, 2 runs this time the yorker is just not quite the right length, a half-volley that Faulkner lifts over wide midwicket but the man running around on the boundary cuts it off
Jordan to Faulkner, 2 runs another couple of runs for Faulkner as he crunches a low full toss back past Jordan
Broad to Coulter-Nile, no run good line outside off and it's driven hard to cover

Broad to Coulter-Nile, 1 run Coulter-Nile goes aerial now, he's flicked this uppishly off his pads and Stokes is at deep midwicket, he runs in and this ball only just falls short of the diving Stokes. Nearly a catch - very nearly a catch.
Broad to Faulkner, no run bouncer this time and Faulkner ducks underneath it
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run angled in to the pads and Faulkner just picks up a single through square leg
Broad to Coulter-Nile, 1 run cut hard into the turf and away to deep point for one more
Broad to Faulkner, 1 run soft hands from Faulkner as he nudges this away for a quick single to midwicket
Stokes to Faulkner, no run banged in short of a length and Faulkner just defends
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run closes the face and works this through square leg for another single
Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 run jams down on a clunky cover drive that finds the sweeper in the deep
Stokes to Faulkner, 1 run Stokes goes for the yorker and Faulkner turns it into a low full toss that he steers wide of mid-on

Stokes to Coulter-Nile, 1 leg bye half a shout for lbw from Stokes as Coulter-Nile tries to work this through leg - there were two noises but it was front pad onto back pad - maybe sliding down leg but not a bad shout
Stokes to Faulkner, no run defended away to the off side

Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run half a chance here for Bresnan, a dropped chance but an incredibly tough one as Coulter-Nile drives it hard back towards the bowler's left - he thrusts the hand out and it doesn't stick
Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run wide of off now and crunched away towards point
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run uppishly driven through cover point now and Bell in the deep collects
Bresnan to Faulkner, 2 runs well wide of off and it's a low full toss, Faulkner can only managed to pick up two over extra cover

Bresnan to Faulkner, 1 run run-out chance here as Bresnan goes full and Faulkner's little inside edge is collected by Buttler, whose underarm throw hits the stumps. Coulter-Nile has slid the bat in nicely though and made good ground. The umpire asks for a replay but Coulter-Nile is shown to be safe
Bresnan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run driven back past the bowler for a single
Jordan to Coulter-Nile, 1 run low full toss again and it's driven back over the head of the bowler
Jordan to Faulkner, no run Jordan mixes it up now with the bouncer that Faulkner perhaps wasn't expecting - the attempted hook misses

Jordan to Faulkner, OUT Jordan gets this one too full but it's brought him a wicket! Faulkner's eyes light up with a full toss at knee height, he's got it high out towards midwicket but hasn't got enough on it to clear the fielder, who takes a comfortable catch.

Jordan to Coulter-Nile, OUT and Jordan finds himself on a hat-trick after getting this one fast and straight enough to have Coulter-Nile lbw trying to walk across and force it through leg. That looked pretty plumb at first glance.
Jordan to Doherty, 1 run no hat-trick for Jordan as Doherty gets one just outside off and crunches it through point for a single
Jordan to McKay, 1 run McKay winds up for a slog but this is collected at mid-on and they just pick up a single

Well, that really was some excellent bowling from England, especially in those last few overs when they just didn't give the batsmen anything much to hit. The early wickets set the tone and Australia could never quite get themselves back into rhythm. George Bailey made a half-century but fell trying to lift the rate.

Welcome back. The first half of this match went well for England, barring some dodgy fielding, a few hours of solid batting should see them win but it's a tricky, slow surface. Australia were subdued throughout against some very good bowling. Xavier Doherty and Shane Watson will have key roles to play with the ball.
Clint McKay with the opening over...
McKay to Cook, 1 wide full and wide outside off, left alone
McKay to Cook, no run closer to off stump, through to the keeper
McKay to Cook, 2 runs good delivery, hint of movement on a full length to find the outside edge but to goes low and wide of slip
McKay to Cook, 1 wide swinging way down the leg side
McKay to Cook, no run back outside off, gentle pace, Cook leaves it alone
McKay to Cook, no run misses out on some width as he cuts to cover off the front foot
McKay to Cook, no run full on off stump, better delivery, defended back to the bowler
McKay to Cook, no run short of a length on the pads, clipped firmly to midwicket on the edge of the ring
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run full outside off, he also finds swing, and it bounces twice through to Wade
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run play and a miss as he shapes to cut a wide delivery, beaten by lack of bounce
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run better delivery, hints the pitch harder back of a length, shaping away from Bell as he leaves
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run a little fuller, left alone again
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run wide outside off, was there for an attacking stroke but Bell happy not to play
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run another leave to end a tidy, if unthreatening over
McKay to Cook, no run full on off stump, defended back towards mid-off
McKay to Cook, 1 wide sprayed wide outside off, another extra, McKay doesn't appear in sync so far
McKay to Cook, 1 run adjusts his line, on middle and leg, worked off the pads behind square
McKay to Bell, no run full at off stump, Bell a good stride down the pitch and defends to short cover
McKay to Bell, FOUR runs first sign of aggression as Bell drives over point, the ball didn't come out of the middle but was struck with enough power to reach the rope
McKay to Bell, no run fuller and closer to off stump, defended to cover
McKay to Bell, no run close! Nearly a return catch. A full delivery, Bell shaping to play through midwicket and the toe-end rushes back towards McKay, low to his right. Finger-tip job.
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 1 run short outside off, stays on the back foot and cuts behind point
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run another leading edge, aiming to play a length delivery through the leg side and the leading edge loops into the covers this time
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run left alone outside off, this one carries nicely to Wade
Coulter-Nile to Bell, FOUR runs that's elegant from Bell, completely in control this as McKay drifts too straight and gets flicked over midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run back outside off, full and driven to cover
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run defended square to point
McKay to Cook, no run full outside off, just starts to come back into Cook as he leaves it alone
McKay to Cook, 1 run shuffles across the crease and works this from around leg stump through the on side
McKay to Bell, no run back of a length outside off, nicely timed square off the back foot but straight to point
McKay to Bell, no run defended to cover
McKay to Bell, 2 runs delicately played by Bell, he started to come down the pitch then opened the face to run the ball to third man
McKay to Bell, no run full on middle and off, defended and the ball runs to square leg
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run touch short, driven off the back foot to cover
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 1 run finds the gap this time as he waits a fraction longer and cuts behind point...third man is quite square
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run almost early with an on-drive again, which brings the danger of spooning a catch and this was in the air a little while towards mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Bell, no run punched to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Bell, FOUR runs ah, that's lovely from Bell...a beautiful back-foot square drive which pierces the gap between point and cover. Technically perfect

Coulter-Nile to Bell, OUT from beauty to the beast! The danger of driving on this pitch, it wasn't a half volley and Bell tried to go on the up and only succeeded in spooning a catch to mid-off. Careless really from Bell, having already been given warning signs with a couple of leading edges.
McKay to Cook, no run left alone outside off
McKay to Cook, no run another one through to the keeper
McKay to Cook, 1 wide down the leg side, Wade goes up for a catch as he thought he heard something but the umpire just calls a wide
McKay to Cook, no run corrects onto off stump, defended to cover
McKay to Cook, 1 run just short! Cook's eyes lit up at a short ball, he went back and pulled and nearly picked out Marsh at midwicket
McKay to Stokes, no run solidly defended to mid-on
McKay to Stokes, no run outside off, Stokes not interested in that one
Faulkner to Cook, 2 runs guided down to third man off an open face, placed fine of the fielder so there's a second on offer
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run tucked away from off stump into the leg side
Faulkner to Stokes, 1 leg bye short delivery, goes for the pull and beaten by a lack of pace as he's through his shot early
Faulkner to Cook, no run on off stump, defended to short cover
Faulkner to Cook, no run angled into the pads, strong appeal from the bowler but that didn't look straight enough...Wade was heading down the leg side
Faulkner to Cook, no run pushed back to the bowler
McKay to Stokes, no run tries to guide this behind square on the off side but was too close to his body and was beaten on the top edge
McKay to Stokes, no run on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
McKay to Root, no run full on off stump, behind the line and defended
McKay to Root, no run edged! But short! Nervous stroke by Root, fiddling outside off trying to guide to third man and it comes off low down the bat, falling in front of Wade
McKay to Root, no run gets across outside off and whips this towards mid-on...hard work out there
Faulkner to Cook, no run back of a length on off stump, played up to mid-on
Faulkner to Cook, no run tries to use his wrists to place this into a gap, but the leg side is tightly packed
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run gets a fraction too straight this time and it's flicked to deep square
Faulkner to Root, no run round the wicket, angled into the stumps, worked to square leg
Faulkner to Root, no run tries to use his feet to come at Faulkner then pushes to cover
Faulkner to Root, 1 run cut firmly down to third man
McKay to Root, no run full on off stump, Root nearly falls across his shot aiming to the leg side
McKay to Root, no run walking into his shot again, pushed to backward point...Root trying to disrupt the length
McKay to Root, 1 run outside edge from a full delivery which holds its line, but it's safely down to third man
McKay to Cook, no run that's a beauty, seams away past Cook's outside from that length which leaves the batsman undecided about whether being forward or back
McKay to Cook, FOUR runs lovely stroke, McKay getting too straight and Cook times it as well as anything today through square leg...bottom hand come into play
McKay to Cook, no run comes forward into a punchy drive, but McKay takes the heat off it in his followthrough
Faulkner to Root, FOUR runs latches onto a short ball, and commits to going up and over...clears midwicket. His movement around the crease helped create that scoring chance
Faulkner to Root, 1 wide outside off, left alone
Faulkner to Root, 1 run now he opens the face and finds third man
Faulkner to Cook, no run short of a length, defended to mid-off
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run now he runs down to third man...one of the release shots on this pitch
Faulkner to Root, 1 run angled into the pads, neatly worked out to deep square...Root sets off thinking of two but it's not on
Faulkner to Cook, no run defended to cover
Doherty to Root, no run round the wicket, full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
Doherty to Root, no run drives into the off side
Doherty to Root, 1 run dragged down short, into the pads, only costs a single into midwicket
Doherty to Cook, 1 run tucked from outside off, with the turn, through square leg
Doherty to Root, no run tight to off stump, Root exposes his timber as he cuts to point
Doherty to Root, no run now he's forward and plays a straight delivery to midwicket
Faulkner to Cook, FOUR runs just over midwicket! Dropped short by Faulkner, Cook pulls firmly off the front foot and gets enough elevation to clear the man inside the ring
Faulkner to Cook, 2 runs a low full toss, clipped along the ground this time and placed in front of square
Faulkner to Cook, no run full outside off, finds his length, gets a thick inside edge into the pads
Faulkner to Cook, 1 run a fraction shorter, driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
Faulkner to Root, no run round the wicket, full outside off, defended behind point
Faulkner to Root, no run gets forward to a full delivery, pushed it back down the pitch
Doherty to Cook, 1 run taken from outside off and work to the left of midwicket...good placement
Doherty to Root, no run driven to backward point
Doherty to Root, no run gets an inside edge into his pads
Doherty to Root, no run wasn't very short but Root played back and cut to point
Doherty to Root, 1 run finds a gap this time out to deep cover
Doherty to Cook, no run picks out square leg
Watson to Root, no run uses his feet, comes down outside off then plays to mid-on
Watson to Root, 1 run 125kph, run down to third man
Watson to Cook, 1 run worked off leg stump out to deep midwicket
Watson to Root, 1 run full on middle, worked just to the right of mid-on who is deep enough to allow a single
Watson to Cook, no run pushed firmly up to mid-off
Watson to Cook, 1 run short of a length, flicked off the back foot through square leg...smart batting from Cook
Doherty to Cook, 1 run close on two accounts! Round the wicket, went to paddle a very full delivery - in fact a full toss - and it falls short of square leg and then it's a tight single
Doherty to Root, no run pushed up to mid-on
Doherty to Root, 1 run onto the back foot, the ball skids on a touch and hurries Root but he is able to work it through square leg
Doherty to Cook, 1 run on the back foot, pushed with a straight bat up to long-on
Doherty to Root, 1 run staying on the back foot and using his wrists to flick it through square leg
Doherty to Cook, no run worked from off stump to midwicket
Maxwell to Root, no run starts off around the wicket and its quite short too. Root finds short fine leg with his pull though
Maxwell to Root, 2 runs flighted on the pads as Root goes down and sweeps to deep square leg
Maxwell to Root, FOUR runs this time it's the reverse and he's got good wood on it. Fetched the ball from around middle and leg and beat deep point comfortably
Maxwell to Root, 1 run a bit of orthodoxy now after the boundary has been taken, driven down the ground
Maxwell to Cook, 1 run stays around to the left-hander as Cook tucks the tossed up delivery on leg towards square leg for a single
Maxwell to Root, 1 run tossed up on leg invites another good sweep shot from Root to end the over as deep midwicket runs to his right to clean up
Doherty to Root, 1 run chips down the track and pushes the flighted ball on off stump down the ground and runs with the shot. Hustles through to complete the quick single
Doherty to Cook, no run nicely flighted on off stump as Cook reaches forward and defends
Doherty to Cook, FOUR runs muscled away, not often you describe a stroke from Cook that way, but he got down on one knee and swept this flat ball on middle with a bit of disdain
Doherty to Cook, 1 run goes back and whips the ball in front of midwicket for a single
Doherty to Root, no run ventures down the track, but having not reached the pitch of this length ball on middle, he resorts to defence
Doherty to Root, 1 run rocks back as this is a touch short and cuts to deep point for a single and that brings up the fifty partnership between these two
Maxwell to Root, 2 runs shortish ball pushed across him as Root goes deep in his crease and cuts through the covers
Maxwell to Root, no run loads of flight from Maxwell, so much that Root is able to take it on the full and lap sweep it to short fine leg
Maxwell to Root, no run the old faithful sweep is in display again, that's the fifth time in two overs, right? Finds short fine leg again
Maxwell to Root, 2 runs flatter delivery on off stump as he rocks back and cuts well in front of point
Maxwell to Root, no run this time it comes a little slower off the pitch to ruin Root's timing. Only gets a thick edge and Root is not pleased. That was a shortish delivery too
Maxwell to Root, 1 run flighted on middle and leg as he nudges it through the midwicket region for a single
Doherty to Root, no run dances down the track and works it away to midwicket, but can't beat the man
Doherty to Root, 1 run room offered outside off stump as Root glides forward and drives through the covers
Doherty to Cook, 1 run premeditated the sweep this time and even if Doherty shortened his length, the line is sufficient to help him beat backward squar leg
Doherty to Root, no run went back to sneak a single to short third man, but there was none on offer
Doherty to Root, no run keeps it on and around off stump as he pushes into the covers
Doherty to Root, no run flighted on middle as he presses forward to nudge down to mid-on
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run lovely line just outside off and Cook allows it passage to the keeper
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run a bit too close for that short to work as Cook guides this short of a length ball on off stump straight to point
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run sways towards leg to whack this short ball with a bit of room outside off, but I think we went at it a bit too hard. Gets a thick bottom edge
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run full and angled across Cook as he comes forward and drives to mid-off
Coulter-Nile to Cook, 1 run punched away past cover. Good balance from Cook as he picks up a single off this back of a length ball just outside off
Coulter-Nile to Root, no run shortish and with just enough width to lure Root into a cut, but he finds point
Doherty to Cook, 1 run fullish, but Cook prefers to go back and cuts this one from off stump to deep point
Doherty to Root, no run vociferous appeal from Doherty as he traps Root on the back foot with a dart on leg stump, might have been sliding down
Doherty to Root, no run tossed up on middle as he leans forward to defend
Doherty to Root, 1 run skips down the track and presents a straight bat despite Doherty shortening his length. Single taken as the ball is hit just wide of mid-off
Doherty to Cook, no run fires it in on leg stump and it hits Cook on the back boot as he looks to flick it away through square leg
Doherty to Cook, 1 run moves forward and slices the full length ball outside off stump with an open face through point
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run magnificent strike, takes a solid stride forward and hits this fullish ball through the line but he cannot beat cover
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run full on off again as he pushes down the ground off the front foot
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run just a bit short and Cook is on the back foot and pulls, but it goes straight o midwicket. Slow pitch hurting the timing of the England captain
Coulter-Nile to Cook, no run length ball angled across him as he steers it off the back foot to backward point

Coulter-Nile to Cook, OUT he's spooned it to short cover! Coulter-Nile is elated as he sends the England captain packing. It was a good length ball, but Cook was early into his drive through the covers. He tried removing the bottom hand off the bat, but that didn't help as the ball strikes the blade a little t
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run fullish and pushed across him as he moves forward and dabs to third man to get off the mark straight away
Doherty to Morgan, no run tossed up on middle as he clips it to midwicket off the front foot
Doherty to Morgan, 2 runs goes down on one knee and takes this tossed up ball on middle and laps it to long leg for a single
Doherty to Morgan, no run strides down the pitch but Doherty tries to push it wide outside off. Morgan's reach is far enough as he drills the ball to mid-on
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run stays back and turns the ball with soft hands just in front of square leg and they scurry through for a quick single
Doherty to Root, no run goes back and punches the length ball down to mid-on

Doherty to Root, 1 run length on off stump as he goes back and punches into the covers. Bailey gets a good bounce and sends in the throw. A direct hit would have had Root there, despite the full-length dive. Doherty might have thought it would break the stumps on it's own. May even have been out had he collect
Coulter-Nile to Root, 1 run full and on middle and leg as he clips the ball through to deep square leg
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run fullish on off stump as he comes forward and drives down the pitch

Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 3 runs chipped just over the top of midwicket. And though two men were running after it, the ball was pulled inside just before striking the boundary rope. Nice shot from Morgan as Coulter-Nile strayed too straight
Coulter-Nile to Root, no run steady line and length on off stump as Root goes back to defend
Coulter-Nile to Root, 1 run on the front foot and flicks the full length ball on middle to deep square leg for another single
Doherty to Morgan, no run full delivery on off stump as he continues over the wicket to the left-hander. Solid forward defence from Morgan
Doherty to Morgan, FOUR runs touch too short and Morgan flays this through extra cover. Loads of power into that stroke
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg as he turns it away through midwicket
Doherty to Root, no run flighted on off stump as Root defends
Doherty to Root, no run driven to mid-off as Doherty attacks off stump with a bit of flight
Doherty to Root, 1 run drags this one short and Root is quick on the back foot as he punches through the covers
Watson to Root, no run back of a length just outside off as Root stands up tall and blocks
Watson to Root, 1 run shortish and Root is propped up nicely on the back foot as he pulls down and in front of square for a couple. Nicely placed as he bisects the two men in the deep there

Watson to Morgan, no run uses soft hands as he dabs it into the off side and rushes down for the single, but Root sends him back. Good, accurate bowling from Watson as this was back of a length outside off
Watson to Morgan, no run punch off the back foot to mid-off as this was shortish and outside off
Watson to Morgan, no run fullish and on a fifth-stump line as he moves forward and drives to mid-off
Watson to Morgan, 1 run works the short ball off the hips to midwicket
McKay to Morgan, no run shortish outside off as Morgan is content with pushing down the ground
McKay to Morgan, 1 run bit short and it had just enough room for Morgan go back and cut past point
McKay to Root, no run full on middle as Root drives solidly to mid-on. He needs to get those in the gap somehow
McKay to Root, no run just back of a good length as Root responds with a back foot defensive
McKay to Root, 1 run length and straying onto the pads, perfect recipe for the flick through midwicket. Nelson's up
McKay to Morgan, no run full on off stump as Morgan stride forward and drives back to the bowler
Watson to Root, no run fullish on off stump draws Root forward and defend as England's required rate inches over five
Watson to Root, no run just short of a good length as he pushes down to mid-off
Watson to Root, 1 run better, works this wide of mid-on after coming down the pitch to meet the fullish ball on middle

Watson to Morgan, SIX runs slapped straight over the top, that's the first six of the game! Watson overpitches this time and the left-hander was waiting for it. Strides forward and unleashes a full swing of the bat
Watson to Morgan, 1 run drops it down towards the point region and scurries through for a quick single. Didn't get it off the middle, but it will suffice
Watson to Root, no run length ball on and around off stump, solidly pushed into the off side as short cover runs to his right and keeps it to a dot
McKay to Morgan, 1 run allows this shortish ball on leg stump to come to him before glancing it down to long leg
McKay to Root, no run fullish and outside off but Root can only push it back to the bowler and walks off briskly towards square leg
McKay to Root, 1 leg bye premeditated scoop shot and the full length ball comes off the bicep. Rushes through for a single as the ball on off runs down to third man
McKay to Morgan, 1 run strays on the pads and Morgan turns it away behind square leg
McKay to Root, no run length ball angled in at the stumps as he defends
McKay to Root, no run length ball on off, punched into the covers
Watson to Morgan, FOUR runs whacks it over the head of the bowler again. No danger in that shot because mid-on is in and Morgan takes full advantage of the length ball on off stump

Watson to Morgan, no run Wade's been struck on the knee as this shortish ball outside off keeps quite low. Morgan was looking to cut it down to third man and though he got quite deep in the crease, he can't connect
Watson to Morgan, no run strides forward this time to drive to mid-off as Watson bowls one full and outside off
Watson to Morgan, no run fullish on off stump as Morgan leans forward and finds mid-off
Watson to Morgan, 1 run plays this so late and employs really soft hands to dab the ball to third man for a single
Watson to Root, FOUR runs short ball, walloped! That should bring considerable relief to Root as he rocked back and launched this over midwicket. One bounce and into the boundary
Maxwell to Morgan, 1 run tossed up and he draws Morgan to play well away from his body, but he controls his dab towards short third man. Sneak a single and Root's dive saves him
Maxwell to Root, no run lovely strike, but he can't place it properly. Finds cover as he belts this shortish ball outside off from Maxwell, who bowls around the wicket
Maxwell to Root, 2 runs flighted on leg stump as Root comes down on the ball with another solid sweep shot

Maxwell to Root, 2 runs full toss and the bat swivels in his hand as he looked to loft this over mid-on. Went off the bottom of the bat and just managed to get it over the head of Doherty who was running back
Maxwell to Root, no run rocks back and punches the shortish ball outside off stump to cover again
Maxwell to Root, SIX runs that's more like it, Rooty! Tossed up on middle and he carts it over midwicket and how. Quite a way to go to your fifty
Faulkner to Morgan, no run good length ball just outside off stump keeps Morgan honest
Faulkner to Morgan, no run tries that dab square on on the off side but point was rushing in. Faulker kept this one back of a length outside off too
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run turns the shortish ball angled in at him down to long leg for an easy single
Faulkner to Root, 2 runs deep midwicket has a job to do and Coulter-Nile does well. Another short ball but this one is punished as Root goes back and pulls quite strongly and in front of square leg
Faulkner to Root, no run full and just outside off as he charges down the track and drills it to mid-off
Faulkner to Root, no run gets a thick inside edge onto the boot as Faulkner keeps it full and on the stumps
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run driven to mid-off as he gets right forward to the full length ball outside off

Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 2 runs enjoys a thickish outside edge, but he was looking to find deep third man anyway. Back of a length just outside off fetches a couple as Root and Morgan hustle between the wickets
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run length ball, but this one is on the pads as he turns it to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run another one a little too straight, but Morgan can't beat midwicket this time either
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, no run rock-solid forward defensive from Morgan as this was full and on off stump
Coulter-Nile to Morgan, 1 run nudges the length ball outside off between point and cover and they pick up a good single
Faulkner to Morgan, FOUR runs another boundary now as Faulkner goes a touch too short and wide and Morgan cuts this away behind point
Faulkner to Morgan, 1 run driven down towards mid-off

Faulkner to Root, 1 bye nearly got through and bowled Root here, this one stays a bit low and it was also too close to off to cut, which was what Root tried to do. Nearly clips his off stump but in the end they get a bye after a ricochet off the keeper

Faulkner to Morgan, OUT there's the wicket Australia needed! And it's Morgan, he's driven this uppishly - but not uppishly enough - to mid-off. He looked like he was trying to clear the field but it's just sailed into the hands of Watson for an easy catch
Faulkner to Bopara, no run solid in defence
Faulkner to Bopara, no run Bopara defends watchfully again
Coulter-Nile to Root, 1 run pushed away towards point for a single
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run solidly defended out to the off side
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run Bopara opens the face and defends to the off side
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run Coulter-Nile goes full and just outside off, it's driven back to him
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run driven down towards mid-on and he can't find the gap
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run Bopara gets off the mark now by opening the face and steering this down to third man
Faulkner to Bopara, no run Faulkner is around the wicket and angles this in towards the off stump, which it doesn't miss by much as Bopara shoulders arms
Faulkner to Bopara, no run Bopara tries another guide to third man but gets it too square
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run clipped away through the leg side for a single
Faulkner to Root, no run Faulkner is over the wicket to Root, who defends back to the bowler

Faulkner to Root, OUT oh boy, now Root is gone! Does this match have a twist in the ending? Root has walked across his stumps and tried to paddle down to fine leg but he didn't get much on it and Doherty at short fine leg in the circle had no trouble taking that
Faulkner to Buttler, no run driven away towards cover
Doherty to Bopara, no run worked away to leg and can't find the gap
Doherty to Bopara, no run prodded away to short midwicket
Doherty to Bopara, no run drifting in from around the wicket and Bopara drives to cover
Doherty to Bopara, no run flatter and quicker at 98kph and Bopara crunches to cover and can't find a run
Doherty to Bopara, no run again quickish at 95kph and Bopara defends
Doherty to Bopara, no run driven away to midwicket and Doherty has managed a maiden during the powerplay, super stuff from him and Clarke for bringing him on
Faulkner to Buttler, 1 run Buttler gets off the mark with a steer behind point
Faulkner to Bopara, no run driven away to cover and can't find the gap
Faulkner to Bopara, no run driven on the bounce to short cover, the gaps are starting to feel non-existent to this pair it seems
Faulkner to Bopara, no run pushed away to the leg side
Faulkner to Bopara, no run again driven to Steve Smith at short cover on the bounce

Faulkner to Bopara, 2 runs Bopara takes a risk now and it's a biggun as he lifts Faulkner high, high out towards long-on, Watson running back from in the circle looks like he's going to make it, he has to sprint a long way back from mid-on, then at the last minute it falls just in front of him and he can only
Doherty to Buttler, no run pushed away to the off side
Doherty to Buttler, 1 run driven down towards long-off
Doherty to Bopara, 2 runs another push towards long-off and well run to turn this into two as Watson is a bit slow getting to the ball
Doherty to Bopara, FOUR runs bad ball and that will be a massive release for Bopara as he pulls a short one all the way to the midwicket boundary
Doherty to Bopara, 1 run tossed up a touch more and Bopara drives down to long-off
Doherty to Buttler, 2 runs clipped away through midwicket and they pick up a couple
Watson to Bopara, 1 run driven down to long-on for a single
Watson to Buttler, 1 run punched away through cover point for another single
Watson to Bopara, no run pushed away to midwicket
Watson to Bopara, no run defended back towards Watson
Watson to Bopara, 1 run tickled away off the pads for a single forward of square leg
Watson to Buttler, no run angling it in towards off stump and Buttler drives it back to the bowler

Coulter-Nile to Bopara, 1 run sharp single here! Risky one as Bopara tucks it off his hip to midwicket and Bailey is quickly on to the ball, his throw from roughly side on just misses and lucky for Buttler it does, as he was short
Coulter-Nile to Buttler, no run driven back past the bowler

Coulter-Nile to Buttler, OUT Buttler is gone now! England are digging themselves into a hole here! A shortish ball from Coulter-Nile gets Buttler's eyes lighting up and he goes for the pull, it comes out of the middle of the bat but not with enough elevation and McKay at deep midwicket takes the catch
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, no run defended back towards Coulter-Nile
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, 1 run Bresnan gets off the mark with a clip off his pads up in the air through midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run full and straight and Bopara drives to the man in the ring on the leg side
Watson to Bresnan, no run Watson goes full at the stumps, the drive can't beat mid-on
Watson to Bresnan, 1 run clipped away through midwicket for a single to the deep
Watson to Bopara, no run nudged away off the pads to the leg side and can't find a gap

Watson to Bopara, 1 run Bopara walks across his stumps and tickles this to short fine leg, he takes off for a quick single and Doherty inside the circle throws at the stumps at the striker's end, misses, but Bresnan was probably just home
Watson to Bresnan, 1 run off a leading edge now as Bresnan tries to work to leg and instead picks up a single in the air to deep point
Watson to Bopara, 1 wide bonus run for England now as Watson sends this one down leg for a wide

Watson to Bopara, FOUR runs there's a much-needed boundary for England as Bopara flashes hard outside off and beats point, and the sweeper from deep cover dives in desperation but can only parry this over the boundary
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, no run goes for a drive down towards mid-on and can't find the gap

Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, 2 runs shortish ball and Bresnan swivels this pull around behind square, and they pick up a couple to Doherty, who doesn't have one of the stronger arms in this Australian team

Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, SIX runs Bresnan gives England some breathing space! He's lifted this off middle and leg and got enough bat on that to clear the boundary at wide midwicket, much-needed six that for England!
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, no run defended back towards the off side
Coulter-Nile to Bresnan, 1 run swinging down the leg side and Bresnan picks up just the single with a clip off his legs
Coulter-Nile to Bopara, no run solid in defence
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run around the wicket to Bresnan, who defends
Faulkner to Bresnan, no run punched away to cover and can't find the gap
Faulkner to Bresnan, 1 run Faulkner runs in and delivers with an Azarenka-like grunt, and it's driven down through mid-on

Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run Bopara works this off his hips to midwicket, Clarke's throw hits at the non-striker's end but the batsman is well home. The umpire asks for a replay, but the replay shows he was so far in he was nearly past the stumps

Faulkner to Bresnan, OUT this time it's gone though! A run-out keeps Australia in the contest as Bresnan gets an inside edge onto his pad and out towards cover, they take off for a run but Bresnan is slow, Maxwell's throw is a direct hit at the non-striker's end and this time Bresnan is well short!
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run Bopara opens the face to run a single down to third man and he'll keep the strike
McKay to Bopara, 1 run Bopara again glides a single down to third man - a run a ball is enough for England, as long as they don't accumulate many dots along the way
McKay to Broad, 1 run Broad almost plays on here! He tries to force a ball through off but it's very straight, this one skews away past leg stump for a single to short fine leg
McKay to Bopara, 1 run another single steered to third man
McKay to Broad, FOUR runs Broad finds the boundary! Big shot this, he's driven it through cover and found the gap - really good placement and that gives England a little breathing space once again
McKay to Broad, 2 runs tickled away off a thickish inside edge for a couple through square leg
Faulkner to Bopara, no run driven straight back to Faulkner for no run
Faulkner to Bopara, no run clipped away to midwicket and Bopara can't find the gap
Faulkner to Bopara, no run again Bopara can only manage to pick out midwicket - he just can't find the gaps here
Faulkner to Bopara, 1 run punched off the back foot down to long-on for a single
Faulkner to Jordan, no run Jordan watchfully defends his first ball

Faulkner to Jordan, 1 run clipped away off his pads out to deep square leg and there is a fumble out there from the fielder but the batsmen weren't prepared to run the second - which means Jordan has the strike
McKay to Jordan, 1 run driven away to point and they get through for a quick single to get Bopara back on strike

McKay to Bopara, 1 run just outside off from McKay and Bopara does what he's been doing all through his innings, steers it off the face down to third man - and in fact it's deflected off Wade's pad, which might have saved any more runs
McKay to Jordan, 1 run clipped uppishly through short midwicket, just wide of the man

McKay to Bopara, OUT beaten outside off! Bopara has again just tried to tickle it away and doesn't get bat on ball. In fact there's a stumping appeal. Has Bopara lifted his foot? Oh this is close. Wade hasn't whipped the bails off, the ball has just ricocheted off him down onto the top of the bails. The third
McKay to Tredwell, 1 leg bye on the pads of Tredwell, who gets a leg bye away
McKay to Jordan, no run all Jordan can do is get bat on ball here and works it to short midwicket
Watson to Tredwell, no run swing and a miss! Tredwell gave himself a bit of room and tried to crunch it through off but couldn't make contact
Watson to Tredwell, 1 leg bye Tredwell tries to lift this over midwicket but can't connect, but they scramble through for a leg bye
Watson to Jordan, 1 run good ball on the stumps and Jordan swings hard to leg, they scamper through for one run to midwicket as Clarke throws and can't hit the stumps at the non-striker's end!

Clarke says he has two days off now before the Test squad flies to South Africa on Wednesday. New challenges ahead for those guys. For now, Michael Clarke is being presented with the series trophy. So the Tests and ODIs combined didn't quite end in the 10-0 that looked possible, but 9-1 is still a very comprehensive

Shane Watson has done the job and with that wicket Australia have moved back up to No.1 on the ICC rankings with a 4-1 series win. England will wonder how they managed to lose that match. When the batting powerplay began with 15 overs left, England needed 70 runs only with seven wickets in hand. But those wickets tum
Australia won by 5 runs
Player of the match is James Faulkner, AUS
